title: What is the meaning and traditional definition of technology? - Quora
tags: English Word Definitions, Terminology, and Jargon

response.answer_text: The definition of technology is science or knowledge put into practical use to solve problems or invent useful tools. Now a days the application of technology is becoming as a common feature in the life of human being just like the necessity of water, electricity, air. The invention of mobile phones definitely changed the social lifestyle of people and even a child is is also very much attracted by it. The computer is another great technology with which internet technology has a greater role. It reduces manual power and energy and working time. Data storage is a wonder thing. Communication made so easy fast in seconds through e-mails. It saves trees that are cutting for manufacturing of papers by thus conservative in protecting environment. Technology made easy to travel from one place to another and transportation faster unlike to traditional means such as walk, bullock cart etc. The technology improving day by day and in every field in construction, developments, transportation, communication, industry, commerce, and much more that every one experiencing . But electricity another great technology is in its back without which technology not grown.

Technology is defined as the application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry, "advances in computer technology, "machinery and equipment developed from the application of scientific knowledge. The branch of knowledge dealing with engineering or applied sciences.

The traditional meaning of science and technology is viewed in different ways. In its broad term technology is dealing with the use and knowledge of humanity's tools and crafts. ... Technology is an innovation, change, or modification of the natural environment to satisfy perceived human needs and wants.
